segments.text: Okay, I need to figure out how to complete this Java code to solve the problem. Let's read the problem again carefully. The problem is about maximizing the AND of all elements in an array after performing at most k operations. Each operation allows us to set a bit in any element to 1. So, the key is to decide which bits to set so that when we take the AND of all elements, it's as large as possible. Hmm, the approach here probably involves considering each bit from the highest to the lowest. Because for the final AND result, a bit can only be set if all elements have that bit set.
segments.label: high_level_plan

segments.text: So, for each bit position, we can decide whether it's possible to set that bit in all elements by using some of our k operations.
segments.label: high_level_plan

segments.text: Let me think: For each bit j (starting from the highest, like 30 down to 0), we check how many elements currently have that bit unset. Let's call that count 'cnt'. If cnt <= k, then we can afford to set that bit in all those elements. Because each of those elements needs one operation to set the bit. So the total operations needed for this bit is cnt.

segments.text: If we do that, then this bit will be set in all elements, contributing to the final AND. So we can include this bit in our answer and subtract cnt from k.
